description: From Middle English laiten, leiten, from Old Norse leita (“to seek, search, inquire”), from Proto-Germanic *wlaitōną (“to look out, see”), from Proto-Indo-European *wel- (“to see”). Cognate with Norwegian Nynorsk leita (“to search”), Icelandic leita (“to search”), Swedish leta (“to search, hunt, forage”), Old English wlātian (“to gaze, observe, look upon, behold”).

verbs.description: lait (third-person singular simple present laits, present participle laiting, simple past and past participle laited)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, UK dialectal, obsolete) To seek; search for; inquire.
examples: By neeght, o' my bed, I laited him, at my sowl luvs : I laited him, but I dudn't find um.
